level.text: A hearing before the Adjustment Board shall be held to determine the guilt or innocence of the resident on the offense(s) charged.
A hearing may be held, at the option of the resident, before a single hearing officer instead of the Adjustment Board.
A hearing shall be held within three (3) working days following receipt by the resident of the written report.
A resident may request one (1) or more continuances of the Adjustment Board hearing. Each continuance may be for three (3) working days.
The Adjustment Board shall grant a request for a continuance if the resident establishes one (1) of the following:
That the resident’s attorney or substitute counsel or any witness would not be available on the day of the hearing; or
That the resident could not properly prepare for the hearing in the time allotted.
If the resident chooses to appear before a hearing officer instead of an Adjustment Board, the Administrator shall designate that hearing officer.
